definition: to swear the oath of office

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: Japan's new foreign minister sworn in .
sentences.chinese: 日本新外相松本刚明宣誓就职。

sentences.english: And stop with the off-topic arguments and swearing.
sentences.chinese: 和停止题外话参数并宣誓就职。

sentences.english: E. g. : He was sworn in as Vice-president.
sentences.chinese: 作为副总统，他宣誓就职。

sentences.english: Ollanta Humala was last week sworn in as Peru's new president.
sentences.chinese: 胡马拉上周宣誓就职成为秘鲁的新总统。

sentences.english: Prime Minister AP was swore in last week.
sentences.chinese: 新任总理阿披于上周宣誓就职。

sentences.english: Foster already has been sworn into the office, which Hastert held for more than 20 years.
The plebe candidates and their cadre leadership prepare for the oath of office.
sentences.chinese: 候选人和他们的普莱贝领导干部准备宣誓就职。

sentences.english: If elected, he would be 72 when sworn in as president.
sentences.chinese: 如果他当选，他在宣誓就职的时候已经72岁。

sentences.english: The 44th U.S. president will take the oath of office on January 20.
sentences.chinese: 明年1月20号，第44届美国总统将宣誓就职。

sentences.english: He will be sworn in before parliament two days later.
sentences.chinese: 两天后内贾德将在议会前宣誓就职。

definition: -elect/designate/(i.e. elected or appointed but not yet installed)
Donald Trump (1946-), American business magnate, US president 2017-
to take office/to assume a post

pinyin: tuo3 yuan2 xing2 ban4 gong1 shi4
